pull.title: refactor: [move-only] Merge core_io module, remove from libkernel
pull.body:
Currently the core_io module is split across two translation units. This will confuse code readers and tooling about the real state of the module.

Fix that by merging the module and removing the mapping workarounds.

Also, remove the module from the kernel lib, because it is not used there: The kernel does not use any json or string parsing or formatting.

rename.from: refactor: [move-only] Merge core_io module, remove from libkernel
rename.to: refactor: [move-only] Merge core_io module, remove from libkernel

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34296. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34296#pullrequestreview-3677797287), [sedited](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34296#pullrequestreview-3677857312) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones: * [#34319](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34319) (Drop some `IWYU pragma: export` and document IWYU usage by hebasto) * [#34308](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34308) (doc: Document IWYU workaround by hebasto) * [#33779](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33779) (ci, iwyu: Fix warnings in `src/kernel` and treat them as errors by hebasto) * [#32729](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32729) (test,refactor: extract script template helpers & widen sigop count coverage by l0rinc) * [#31650](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31650) (refactor: Avoid copies by using const references or by move-construction by maflcko) * [#28690](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28690) (build: Introduce internal kernel library by sedited) If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
ACK fa93e014c8a3482c3084f88b7fe4734022633398, I have reviewed the code and it looks OK.

Concept ACK

This became possible after introducing a bespoke small hex parser in `bitcoin-chainstate.cpp` in #30595. We should eventually re-use our own internal utilities for things like hex parsing in our small tool binaries. The `strencodings` module can be used for that, so removing `core_read` from the kernel doesn't make this more complicated.

I agree, and we may even go further: Make core_io use the kernel, instead of re-implementing the logic? I think in combination with https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30595#discussion_r2640145604 this would even lead to a speedup for free? Happy to work on this in a follow-up, if there is no obvious issue I am missing.

> The strencodings module can be used for that, so removing core_read from the kernel doesn't make this more complicated.

Although looks like the `strencodings` and `string` modules could be removed from the kernel lib now too?

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
 This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).
